It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal] 1833 Aug., State of Tennessee [to] Sheriff of Anderson County / [witnessed by Will Swan]
bibl.author: [witnessed by Will Swan]
bibl.note: This is a court order to the sheriff of Anderson County, Tennessee dated August 1833. The order is witnessed by Will Swan. The sheriff is ordered to bring several men as defence witnesses before the court for the case O'Brien vs McCormack.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: To The Sheriff of Anderson County

div.p:
We Command you to summon James Sarvey James Kirkpatrick Larkin H Bowling & Charles McCormak Jr to appear before the Judge of our Circuit Court, at a court to be held on the 2d Monday of February next, for the county of Knox at the Court House in Knoxville to testify and the truth to say in a cause depending in said Court, between Chas Y Obrien
Plaintiff and Chas Charles McCormack Defendant on behalf of the Deft Defendant and this they shall not omit under the lawful penalty.
Witness, Will Swan Clerk of our said Court at Office, in Knoxville the 2d Monday of August 1833

R Olmsh
